website_summaries.verdict: A great variety of drilling sizes are included, with only five step drill bits. Offered at a nice price.
pros: Step sizes for drill bits from 1/8 to 1 3/8 inches
Titanium coating provides durability and high-speed precision
cons: Mixture of 3/8- and 1/4-inch shanks may not fit some drills

customer_reviews.title: Great bits but must be used properly.
customer_reviews.text: I’d like to start by saying, I only purchased these to be used for a one off project that I needed to drill about 10 holes in 18 gauge stainless steel on kegs. There are couple of reviews on here about them being unable to drill through stainless and the bits were ruined when used on a keg. But after using these bits “the proper way” they will drill like higher end step drill bits. Drill a pilot hole, use a slower drill speed, cooling oil and firm pressure these will drill through almost anything and will last. I have made 10 holes in 304L stainless varying from 7/8” to 1-1/4” and bits are still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: For casual use- perfect
customer_reviews.text: Ok if you are going to use these every day in hard-use, industrial applications, I wouldn’t be surprised if they didn’t work for you. (I’ve been there). For casual, sporadic residential use, these bits are awesome. Once you use a step bit you’ll wonder what you ever did without them, and you’ll rarely use a small hole saw again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: They're not the bee's knees of step bits, but ...
customer_reviews.text: They're not the bee's knees of step bits, but you won't beat them for the price. If you're a residential electrician who has to make the occasional modification to a box and you have no step bits... these are more than enough. If you're a commercial electrician who debates sending a particular common used metal box to a metal fab, in bulk, for a common punch out modification but wonders if a step bit will get you by, you 'might' want to try these, but one of those seemingly expensive sets might be more in order for remedying an issue in the field. Though, if you're the latter and successful, you're not gonna quible over price, are ya?
customer_reviews.author: 411DL

customer_reviews.title: Useful and high quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to drill a 5/8 inch hole for the hitch pin in my trailer receiver tube because the existing hole kept the ball too far from the hitch to allow my safety chains to attach. I used plenty of oil and was able to easily drill 2 holes through the 1/8 inch steel of the tube. The drill bit that I used did not seem to be dulled and upon inspection appeared to be as good as new when I was done. I don't know why I never bought a set of these before--I would have used them if I had them.
customer_reviews.author: deej

customer_reviews.title: cheap bits, as expected
customer_reviews.text: At about $3 per bit, these were suspiciously inexpensive. I only needed them to drill two 1-3/8" holes in a steel sheet, but they barely did that even with a 1" pilot. They're probably ok for casual work in plastic or wood, but if you're drilling through steel, even a thin sheet, I would strongly caution you against this product. After only a few seconds of drilling the bits were dull, bent, and smoking. My sheet was coarsely disfigured and smoking as well. If you're going to use this produce for drilling in metal either precisely or repetitively, do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Junk, don't cut for sh*8
customer_reviews.text: Junk bit doesn't cut. I needed the large 1in bit to drill into my vehicles firewall for car audio power wire. The bit is not sharp and doesnt cut. It barely expanded the hole I had already made with another bit which was already at 3/4 diameter. The bit itself already started to discolor and it was struggling to cut into the thin sheet metal that my other 3/4 bit cut with ease. A total let down. Do not buy this garbage. FYI if you want a good set my other set which cut the firewall like butter was brand QWORK. This Neiko brand is worthless. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Knowledge Seeker

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend my hard earned money on multiple $50 unibits and after a quick look online i came across this set. I decided to just try them based on the reviews, and after a year later these bits are still going VERY strong. Im honestly stunned how great these are. As an electrician i have to unibit holes almost daily, and these bits do it all from pvc boxes to 30x30 metal junction boxes to panels. These have everything ive wanted and then some. I tell everybody on the job who are looking for new bits about this set because they are amazing. Will definitely buy again if i ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Was sent a used set but next set looks good
customer_reviews.text: I got a set for work. My first one arrived looking like it was used. There was damage on the case and the bits looked dulled a bit. I sent it back and got another one. The second set looked new this time and not too bad. I haven't used them yet but when I do I'll update the review. It may be a while since I don't need this type of bit often but when I do I need them specifically. I use them both on plastic and hard metal so I'll update accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Dad who works as a machinist after he managed to break a step drill from another brand. Drills come in a nice blow molded case and work great for putting holes in aluminum and steel in scenarios where you can't risk the material climbing up a standard drill bit. Overall excellent quality, I can tell these will last him a long time.
customer_reviews.author: C944

customer_reviews.title: These are good
customer_reviews.text: So,being an electrician I need step bits pretty regularly. These cut well, they hold an edge good. I'm not particular nice to these, I figure they need to work for me. They do a great job.and honestly, they are cheap enough of I do ruin one it isn't going to break my heart.
customer_reviews.author: paul dalton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in case Step Drill Bit set
customer_reviews.text: I have several step brill bits, but this is nice as it comes in case with five bits. I needed the bit for aquick hole in plastic. The set came in quickly, and I completed my project in no time. The Titanium bits are made of high precision.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago1985

customer_reviews.title: Good set to have
customer_reviews.text: This step drill set is great. The bits appear to be made of good quality. They come in a nice little hard case. Only problem I found is that the foam that is used to set them in melted onto the bits but I don't think it will be a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: Many like it but this is the best
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase and the cost Ive used many different brands and sizes but this is the best one thus far, i usually break them but ive used this ones for a months making holes in 1/2 metal and such with no issues when they hreaks i will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect labeling of shaft sizes
customer_reviews.text: I just received this set and detected a discrepancy in the actual shank sizes and the sizes of the incremental steps labeled on both the box and as advertised on Amazon. The 1/8" to 1/2" range in 1/32" increments actually has a 1/4 inch shank; the 1/4" to 3/4" bit in 1/16" increments actually has a 3/8" shank. One can see this discrepancy also in the photo shown. One would be disappointed if a 1/8" to 1/2" range in 1/32" increments with a 3/8 inch shank was needed. Neiko needs to do a better proof reading job on their labeling on their boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper Bee

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a total waste of time. I can't attest to the quality of the bits, as they were a bit corroded upon arrival, they're not used, but they look like they've been around forever. The "aluminum" case is actually entirely plastic and was cracked in several places and totally falling apart...yet the manufacturers box it arrived in was pristine, so this was crap direct from the factory. I think I'll just go with a cheap HFT set at this point. Least I'll get the project done this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: twelve feet under

customer_reviews.title: ... step drills are well made and come in a nice aluminum storage case
customer_reviews.text: These step drills are well made and come in a nice aluminum storage case. I used one of the step drill to enlarge holes in a piece of 15 gauge galvanized angle that I use to hold my screwdrivers. The step bit bored through this metal very quickly with absolutely no problems. The bored hole was perfectly round with only slight burrs on the outlet side of the hole (expected). I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to create some new bird houses and needed to drill cleanly into tin coffee cans. These worked perfectly. I could not say if they would work so perfectly in any other medium, but for me, at the price, these have been perfect. Right tool, right job, as it says in the Bible.
customer_reviews.author: Mergatroid

customer_reviews.title: Junk!  Can't Drill Mild Steel!
customer_reviews.text: Got this set to replace my old "worn out" step bit. First time I used one, it dulled and stopped drilling the second it hit steel. I had the bit in a drill press and was using a lubricant. My old bit got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for light duty work.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, nice case, cuts fast up to 12gauge sheet metal but anything thicker the bit burns. It cant handle overspeed, burns easily. I've used other brands/regular type that would go through 1/4" thick steel plates effortlessly with only a pilot hole and slight lube.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great for plexiglass
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic at drilling holes in plexiglass for an arcade1up retropie conversion. One of these bits at a hardware store is more money than this whole set. No problems with the bit grabbing and shattering like my normal drills bits.
customer_reviews.author: brian richards

customer_reviews.title: They Work
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these to ream out a hole in a metal piece but I ended up not needing to do so. So far, I have only used these to create a hole in plasitic, which they did with aplomb. They came sharp and the plastic it cut spiraled out the top as expected and made quick work of the job. Since I haven't used these on anything harder yet, I will reserve rating these any higher until I can see what they do then and what type of longevity I can expect.
customer_reviews.author: It's Me

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely can't beat the price for these decent quality bits!
customer_reviews.text: I've used mine to cut through many panels of 18ga steel as well as numerous other materials and haven't had and issues and bits still seem sharp. I've used many different brands over time and these honestly do at least as well and last just as long so far. The carrying case Is OK... Better than throwing them in a tool box but not as great as some posts have made it out to be tho. Still a great value.
customer_reviews.author: crazytekkieTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Neiko 10197A titanium step drill Bit Set in an aluminum, padded case
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set, will work great on just about anything except stainless steel-which I knew when I bought it. I was willing to spend the money for a one time project that required drilling 1 1/4 inch holes into stainless steel knowing that the bit would only last through a couple of holes. The metal case the drills came in is also top notch.
customer_reviews.author: BunkerHill

customer_reviews.title: Good quality , good looking
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I need for plastic and soft wood. Not sure the product is suitable for metal .
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to use them on anything metal yet, but they worked perfectly for the thick heavy plastic I needed to cut holes in. Plus the case they come in is nice as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Only used once on 3/16 inch plate and already burned up and ruined two of these bits.
customer_reviews.author: Scott DVM

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Cut through my steel sink just fine to help me cut a hole for my RO system faucet
customer_reviews.author: Spman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: Junk bought awhile ago and finally used them. 2 holes in light gauge ductwork and bit is smoked.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lew

customer_reviews.title: nice set
customer_reviews.text: Good for light to medium duty, the case is sturdy too. I think it was a good value
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing product. I have never owned a set of drillbits like this, and it leaves me wondering why I never bought these before.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: and hardness and am pleased to report these have held up better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I've drilled through a whole bunch of different metal with varying thickness, and hardness and am pleased to report these have held up better than expected! Theyre still sharp after a few months, and a bunch of projects.
customer_reviews.author: Cory H.

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat em for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these in my home shop for a little over 2 years without a single issue. Granted, I don't drill stainless steel very often but for all the mild steel and aluminum I work with, as well as plastics they've been great used as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Justin K.

customer_reviews.title: Total junk. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. It was dull before I got through the very first pass of a 3/16 inch piece of Steel. I pulled out a very cheap regular drill bit and drilled 30 holes with the same tiny bit. This thing is junk. Did I say that?
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Good choice for 20 bucks, if you know how this works, that should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Luis

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: Was using Snap-On HS drill blades to drill through 3/8” hardened steel. This took a few minutes and was stressing on the bits. Purchased this, was skeptical on these. After using these for at least 50 drills I can say these are absolutely great. Cuts through steel in seconds, like cutting through butter. Start a little pilot hole when starting then add cutting oil. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: good quility! They are not!
customer_reviews.text: These bits are dull as all hell! Didn't even cut through aluminum!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W.

customer_reviews.title: Know your job. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine for aluminum. No idea why people are trying to bore holes in thick steel with a cheap set like this. I went slow and used 3 in 1 oil and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job done
customer_reviews.text: Been working well perfect holes every time with ease. Quality made .
customer_reviews.author: Djordan

customer_reviews.title: A good step drill set for plastics and light metal
customer_reviews.text: Im pretty happy with the Neiko 10197A 5-Piece Step Drill Bit Set. They're probably not heavy duty enough for thicker material but do work great on plastics. I did notice as another did that some of the foam inlay from the case did stick to or melt onto the bits. On my set, it wasn’t a large amount and came off easily. Anywhoo, they cut nicely and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Ian MazurskyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Work great, only reason for not giving 5 stars is because one has stopped cutting beyond a certain point.
customer_reviews.author: William Yaeger

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.  Not easiest to read the script on a couple of the bits.
customer_reviews.text: Script is kinda hard to read on a few of them. I have not had much use out of them yet so i cannot speak to long term durability but they work quite nicely and the case is handy. No real signs of wear after a half dozen holes or so on them. Hard to speak to a step bit quality until they get a few hundred more holes drilled. So good for now.
customer_reviews.author: EN Wags

customer_reviews.title: I get clean holes every time and the case is a great addition where many others just send you the bits ...
customer_reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't been said. These are inexpensive and very high quality. I've never understood how others can charge ten times more for the same thing. I've used them on plastic and up to 20ga steel and aluminum plate without issue. I get clean holes every time and the case is a great addition where many others just send you the bits in a blister pack. I'll recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: CoffeeDragon

customer_reviews.title: Stays sharp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent step drill bits, cut through 1/8 plate steel with ease
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these a while back for my shop and i purchased another recently for my tool trailer. Don't let the low price lead you to believe it's a cheaply made product. Great product, great price, works exceptionally. I use on metal and wood. I've sunk holes in 1/2 inch steel and these bits haven't let me down yet. I don't write many reviews but these deserved the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan d Williams

customer_reviews.title: Cut great but already starting to loose their edge
customer_reviews.text: So far pretty good, works great on wood and epoxy, already loosing their edge a bit though, and I haven't used them on anything tougher than aluminum. It is very handy to have the full set. Size markings are hard to read but its not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp, clean cut, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. Just used it to drill a 13/16 hole for the thermometer on my grill. Very sharp, quick, and clean cut. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They've improved the product!
customer_reviews.text: it's the second time I buy this. I've worn out most the bits, but it serves me well. they've improved the case to a hard plastic molded case, which is much better in my opinion. For the price, I think this represents good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked on our steel sink
customer_reviews.text: Did a nice job of taping a hole on our steel sink for the reverse osmosis water faucet to come out from.
customer_reviews.author: cybershopper46

customer_reviews.title: ... use them but the storage container shown was nothing like the cheap plastic case I received
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had a chance to use them but the storage container shown was nothing like the cheap plastic case I received.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W. Lowery

customer_reviews.title: First Class Tool Set of Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: This set of step drills is first class HS steel with Cobalt finish and the little case is PERFECT. I expect these drills to last for years to come, and the case is worth what I paid for the set even if it were empty. It is a terrific value! Even if one of these bits might snap someday, there is significant overlap between them so... no problem. Heck if they all broke, I would keep the case and refill it with replacement bits.
customer_reviews.author: BigCheese

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE OUTSTANDING!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the cheep versions of step drill before... with that said THESE ARE OUTSTANDING! They cost a fair amount however these were night & day compared to the other brands. They cut very quickly & FAST with minimal pressure on push down. Come in a very nice case & I would recommend these over the cheep ones all day long!
customer_reviews.author: K. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I have not used these a lot, but they have worked great so far. I am not into real heavy drilling or stainless steel, but they have worked well on the mild steel I work with. Love the case they came with.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Won't last forever
customer_reviews.text: I got these to drill out electrical boxes. They work but dull after several holes. I still deal I got my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Case was broken
customer_reviews.text: Case was broken but this is an awesome step but set, if you dont have a set, buy one. No rust or anything which is perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: jd picchietti

customer_reviews.title: Did not last in thin meteal
customer_reviews.text: These drill bits quickly dulled in fairly thin metal. I returned them for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: K Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good so far, time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad set for $30. And a fairly decent case to keep it all together. Also, it is size-marked at each step so you know where to stop. Only four stars is because it's hard to start a hole with these. A small pilot hole,(1/8, 3/16) works wonders, but that's one more thing to take up the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: A. Noid

customer_reviews.title: Assorted sizes work great
customer_reviews.text: I bore a lot of holes for installations. These are perfect, don't full, and cut quickly.
customer_reviews.author: M C Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very tough, difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: Very good bits, but cutting plastic leaves plastic dust adhered to the bits and it requires scrubbing to clean it off.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tim Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: But with confidence
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bits don’t waste your money on cheaper ones these are truly great
customer_reviews.author: renzo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product so far
customer_reviews.text: I had to put 2, 3/4" holes in 3/16" mild steel. The manufacturer suggested I use a stepped bit. I was leery, purchased this particular set as it seemed the best bang for the buck in my circumstances and commenced to drill the holes. Wow, was I surprised at how quickly and easily I was able to drill through this steel. And I did use a cutting lubricant.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: I'm building my own squat rack and just drilled 140 ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm building my own squat rack and just drilled 140 5/8" holes through 1/8" mild steel with no issue at all. I bought the multi pack expecting to junk at least one or two bits but one did it perfectly and it's still solid. I kept the speed slow and used cutting fluid which is the proper way to do it. These are definitely worth the money. One bit at a big box store is almost 50$.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M Genzel

customer_reviews.title: If you're a light user like me, I'm sure you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Handy item, works well for me. I'm not a hardcore user though. If you're a light user like me, I'm sure you won't be disappointed. If you're a hard user or professional machinist, I can't say how this will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as stated and half the price compared to what you'd find at the big box stores. Used these to drill new holes for bump stops and extended brake line brackets during a lift kit installation for a jeep
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: Good bargain set.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price on this set. The only one that doesn't work well is the largest. That's probably due to the fact that it removes the most amount of metal and thus dulls faster. I'm ok with that since the really good ones this size cost three times the price of this whole set!
customer_reviews.author: Peter S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Had them about 2 weeks now. Used them on plastic and aluminum so far. They work great! The case was not bent like some reviews said. Came right on time and should work for the do it yourself people. Might be a little light duty if you were to use it daily. I would recommend to a friend. The case will keep them from damage in your tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Hyland Lyle

customer_reviews.title: It is wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought these years ago!!! puts a perfectly trimmed hole in anything from plexiglass, to metal car doors for speaker wires. You just stop when the hole is the size you want, and it does not pull or walk!! It is wonderful!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Burn your money instead
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself some headache and buy Irwin's up front. This is bar none, the least effect step bit I've ever attempted to use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Frymyer

customer_reviews.title: Not high quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked for my project of thin plastic other then that ng
customer_reviews.author: Peter F.

customer_reviews.title: Not for stainless
customer_reviews.text: These are great for plastic and soft woo or metal. I tried to use one on stainless steel and it just wrecked the bit and got hot.
customer_reviews.author: CTO

customer_reviews.title: should’ve pitched this sooner
customer_reviews.text: So many uses that I did not ever think I’d need. Makes small fab work so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lazaro Robert Casas

customer_reviews.title: Nice set!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set because the whole set is about the same price as a single bit at a big box store. I needed to enlarge some 5/8" holes in my boat to 3/4", to install some fender cleats in them. The bit worked perfectly. Nice clean enlarged holes!
customer_reviews.author: North Georgia Hawg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I have done several project which otherwise I would not have dared to do. Drills holes through stain less steel with ease, not heating or smoking, for the most simple task you may not need cooling oil or water. Every garage should have one, I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: great tools
customer_reviews.text: Work like a charm. Never having anything like this before - and i am a DIY geek - they work very well. Unlike drill bits one can make more hole sizes and they are much cleaner and easier too. I dont use them often but when i do they perform - thus for my use they would last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Jan F

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant at first purchase these for the price but after using them several times I am very impressed with the quality and they do not seem too dull especially compared to the ones that are $40 apiece
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I got it today and used it right away great value and tonight
customer_reviews.text: I got it today and used it right away great value and tonight ,no one can beat that price ,else you buy one price for 40,50 bucks is very price ,thump up ,buy it you won't get wrong ,thank you neko
customer_reviews.author: Jayzzz

customer_reviews.title: The bits are high quality unlike some cheaper sets that go dull after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: An essential tool for your collection. This is the only way to drill larger holes in thin material. The bits are high quality unlike some cheaper sets that go dull after a few uses. Great value for the money, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin L. Stroyny

customer_reviews.title: May not be great if you're using them everyday
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far. May not be great if you're using them everyday, I haven't used them enough to comment on their longevity but after about a dozen uses they are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zero complaint :D
customer_reviews.text: Works great for sheet metal and copper lugs. havn't tried it on anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Cooper

customer_reviews.title: They work great and are a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a set of these for myself and a few people that I work with. They work great and are a great price! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: They work wonderfully. Just remember
customer_reviews.text: I have used these to cut through wood, plastic, and metal. They work wonderfully. Just remember: with metal, go slow and use cutting oil.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M.

customer_reviews.title: Great step drills!
customer_reviews.text: These step drills are great! I've tried a number of different brands of step drill. Most leave some burrs in the hole, requiring a file to clean before attaching antennas. And you can't leave the burrs, since we need our antennas to be waterproof. These drills don't leave burrs. They punch a clean hole, and seem to be quite durable. Overall, I'm very impressed with the kit. An added bonus is the case. Nice metal case, with the padded inserts, as shown. Keeps the drills from getting the normal toolbox rash.
customer_reviews.author: AngelKiha31

customer_reviews.title: Not effective on stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: The tip could not stand up to stainless steel applications. The Tim was good for 23 in the directions. After that it started walking.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: A fine collection
customer_reviews.text: How many times have you gotten into a project that requires you to enlarge a hole and you didn't have the right drill bit? This is the deal for those occasions. The neat thing about this kit is that it comes with a nice case to keep the step-drills sharp. For the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michael Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Very long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set back in 2015. They have finally worn out after 3 years of use. I definitely recommend buying these.
customer_reviews.author: keith gudeman

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice set of bits
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice set of bits, but they dull rather quickly, making this nice set a useless set. You'll get some use out of them, but not enough to call them a long term set in your bit arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: MeanMan 5

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: We bought this set to replace a much older and badly worn set in the shop. This case is nifty, but VERY cheaply made, barely adequate for home use but certainly its flashier than an injection molded plastic one. We do not use the case. The bits are better than the case. They are not marked as to what type of steel they are made of, but the machining and finishing appears to be visually good. We have no way to determine how brittle they are, or how well they deal with severe sideways torsion (breaking). So far they have stood up to commercial usage and cut through acrylic, HIS, polycarbonate, PVC, HDPE and Delrin with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn T. Hangartner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal
customer_reviews.text: I've used these a few times now and smile everytime. They are definitely worth the money. The case they came in is ready to be abused in your tool bag but will certainly keep these guys safe.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Heagarty

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for it. The case they come in is more value to me.
customer_reviews.author: W. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Good product and a nice variety of bits.
customer_reviews.text: Bits are great. Work as expected and as advertised. Case looks a bit wore, as if it rode on the outside of the truck in shipment.
customer_reviews.author: JLoh

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Value!
customer_reviews.text: Tremendous Value! These step bits are value priced and really work well for their intended purpose. Quick ship, quality made, economical alternative to ridiculous local tool store prices.
customer_reviews.author: paedomorph

customer_reviews.title: These are great, and for the price you can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: These are great, and for the price you can't beat it, 5 steps bits and an aluminum case for $30, i will take that all day. The one thing i will say is that they are titsnium coated bits, and will probably dull a little quicker than a higher priced bit, but at this price replacement is very affordable. Great set!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tools great having different sizes in one case.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor L.

customer_reviews.title: very nice set for the price and has drilled plenty of ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice set for the price and has drilled plenty of holes for me in a variety of materials... steel, aluminum, plastics...
customer_reviews.author: I buy lots of stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great bits
customer_reviews.text: I was really iffy about buying these at first bc normally vary bits are forty or fifty dollars for just one but I was really surprised at how good these bits cut they work just as good as any of the Irwin bits I have had I would definately recommend these
customer_reviews.author: JT91

customer_reviews.title: Sweet set
customer_reviews.text: Why buy them individually when you can get the set in a sweet holder?? I was even able to squeeze a couple extra bits in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: I am not sure why I did not buy these earlier!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why I did not buy these earlier! Great product and works well in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: J.K.Yates

customer_reviews.title: Great bits but the case was beat!
customer_reviews.text: I assumed that I was going to be getting a brand new case with my bits but that was DEFINITELY not the case. The case had dents and scratches all over it. The bits looked new so I decided to keep them. The case would have been beat up in a month anyhow so I kept the whole thing. The largest bit in this set sells for 50$ at Home Depot and it does not come with a case so I am pleased with the 30$ I paid on Amazon. I just wish they would have described the case as "used" because mine was definitely just that. The bits are a 5star but the case is a 1star.
customer_reviews.author: David Jorn

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: My set came incomplete. It did not have the biggest bit.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy M.

customer_reviews.title: Any size hole you need.
customer_reviews.text: Whatever the material, you can size a hole an almost any material you can imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Saltwater Sniper (DJA)

customer_reviews.title: I have used these a few times now on sheet ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these a few times now on sheet metal with no signs of ware. Just keep them oiled them up when you use them
customer_reviews.author: matt v.

product_meta.title: Neiko 10197A Titanium Step Drill Bit Set, High Speed Steel | 5-Piece Set | Total 50 Sizes
product_meta.description: A high quality 13 piece Torx Bit Socket and E-Socket Set. This Torx set features with heavy duty construction. Chrome Plated and Mirror Polished. 1/4-Inch drive: T8, T10, T15, T20, T25, T27, T30 x L 37mm. 3/8-Inch drive: T40, T45, T47, T50, T55 x L48mm.
feature_bullets: Classic high speed steel with titanium coating for proven capability and durability in drilling holes in plastic, aluminum, copper, stainless steel and many other types of sheet metal
135° split point and two flute design increases cutting speed with self-centering and prevents walking, clears chips faster and allows particles to escape easily
Tri flatted shank fits into power tools chuck securely and eliminates slip
Set includes a sturdy blow molded organizing case for secure storage and easy carrying
